intro: Cathedra aestuaria, commonly known as the salt marsh sedgeland, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions. It thrives in brackish or saline environments, often found in wetlands and tidal flats. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are adapted to withstand salt spray and fluctuating water levels. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically clustered in dense spikes, and it plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal soils. Cathedra aestuaria is an important component of estuarine ecosystems, supporting a variety of wildlife.
